history.text: Hello!
How are you doing today?
I am good. How are you?
I am doing great, thank you!
Today we will be talking about the movie "The social network"
Have you seen it before?
I thought The Social Network was brillant!
Yes I have seen it.
Sorkin is terrific at dialogue.
I've never seen it before.
It seems interesting though!
It is well worth your time.
What is the main point of the movie?
It shows how Facebook was founded and the people behind it.

That sounds intriguing. What do you think the moral of the story is
?
I think the moral is ambiguous but the movie gives real insight into the founding of Facebook.
It's pretty unflinching in it's protrayal of the characters.
That is cool :) I always wondered how Facebook was founded!
I noticed a review speaking of the movie" defining the dark irony of the past decade"; I feel like maybe it is a representation of how much social media has been integrated into our lives.
It definitely shows that, it also is a reflection of the dot.com industry and the unexpected rise of the people involved. So I think that is part of the irony.
It seems like a well thought out film.
What was your favorite scene?
Probably in the beginning, when it shows just hoe unlikely the founders are at becoming so successful and rich.
*how
I like that!
The combination of David Fincher as director and Aaron Sorkin as writer is a total win for the film.
I wonder, if that is how Mark Zuckerberg was? Unlikely to become successful and rich
And did he actually go to Harvard? Do you know?
What other movies has David Fincher directed?
Yes he went to Harvard
Fincher also directed Fight Club and Zodiac
interesting, it seems like maybe he would have been successful in whatever he chose to do with a degree from such a high quality school
Nice, I have heard of Fight club!
Absolutely, but the chances of him becoming the billionaire he is now were pretty unlikely.
I would like to read the book that this movie is based upon. "The accidental Billionaires"
That is a great point!
Thank you for joining me, have a wonderful day! :D
The film also shows how controversial the founding was because it was tied up in so many lawsuits.

uid1response.feedback: Thank you for the opportunity to participate in this study!

uid2response.feedback: There was some inaccurate info in the movie's summary. It had 2 sentences that were about the movie "Superman" instead of the movie "The Social Network"
